inputs.selection_motivation: Atlantic hurricane season risk raises perceived financial market risk, prompting the Fed to adjust policy to maintain stability and manage inflation expectations.
inputs.candidate_motivation: The source topic concerns hurricane‑induced risk premiums on the UST 10‑year curve, so the most relevant peers are other UST maturities, the overall Treasury curve, and macro variables that drive the curve and flight‑to‑quality flows. Fed policy and inflation expectations are key catalysts for the curve, while the dollar index and US inflation data influence the risk‑premium channel. These topics provide the strongest direct, competitive, or correlative links to the source.

proposed_link.motivation: Atlantic hurricane season risk raises perceived financial market risk, prompting the Fed to adjust policy to maintain stability and manage inflation expectations.
